intro: Niara montanensis, commonly known as the mountain niara, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to deep red. Niara montanensis typically grows in rocky or well-drained soils, often in forested mountainous areas. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
